properties.areaDesc: West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet
properties.senderName: NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 4 at 8:52PM MST until February 5 at 8:00AM MST by NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM TO IMPACT THE SACRAMENTO MOUNTAINS, THE EASTERN
LOWLANDS OF OTERO COUNTY, EL PASO AND HUDSPETH COUNTY...

.Extended advisory to El Paso County due to precipitation band
changing to snow earlier than expected, which will increase snow
totals for El Paso, especially before midnight. Cold front moving
through the area with drop temperatures rapidly and change any
precipitation to snow overnight. Some moderate to heavy snow is
currently falling over the Sacramento Mountains and should
continue into Wednesday morning. The east slopes and central
portion of the mountains are expected to receive the heaviest
snowfall as low level east flow increases throughout tonight. Snow
accumulation is expected across El Paso and Hudspeth Counties and
the lowlands of Otero County. The snow should taper off and end
by around noon on Wednesday.

* WHAT...Snow. Up to 2 inches of snow has already fallen today.
Overnight accumulations of 2 to 4 inches are expected.

* SNOW AMOUNTS...Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches.

* WHEN...Until 8 AM MST Wednesday.

* WHERE...West slopes of the Sacramento Mountains.

* TIMING...Occasional snow is expected this afternoon, with
occasional moderate snow overnight.

* IMPACTS...Snowfall will create slick roads and reduce
visibility making for hazardous travel conditions.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST WEDNESDAY
